questions.question_text: The Single Loss Expectancy is $1.000.000 and the Annual Rate of Occurrence is 20%. What is the Annualized Loss Expectancy?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Answer: B. $200,000
explanation: 1m x .20, ALE = SLE * ARO
source: math

Selected Answer: CD
@tomrdu incorrect. Answer is C and D. Assessment Context is a section in RAM record that has "Assess" field with 2 options - Risk and Object

Selected Answer: CD
When you create a new "Risk Assessment Methodology", under the Assesment Context section, Assess field has two choice values:
1. Risk
2. Object
C and D is correct. if you look at the form in the PDI, you will see these 2 as the choices.

questions.question_text: What options are available when configuring the assessment context for a risk assessment methodology RAM)? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Define a control before you define a control test. In order to define a control, you need the entity that should be scoped with the control and best possible choice is C.

What are key prerequisites for a control test task to be generated?
 A. Engagement is Scope
 B. Risks have associated assessments
 C. Entity being scoped has associated controls with test plans
 D. Controls have a set frequency
 E. Entity being scoped has associated risks
Answer: C. Entity being scoped has associated controls with test plans
Explantion: ¯\_(ツ)_/¯
Source: ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

questions.question_text: What are key prerequisites for a control test task to be generated?

choices.C: Entity being scoped has associated controls with test plans
choices.E: Entity being scoped has associated risks

questions.question_text: Who should be directly involved in GRC implementations? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CEF
Ok, the key here is using the word "directly"; whereas all of the listed groups SHOULD be involved in GRC implementation project, we can not expect that someone from the Board of Directors could be engaged directly in operational/implementation activities.

Answer: 
 C. ServiceNow platform experts
 E. Risk and compliance experts
 F. CMDB process owner
Explanation: trust me bro.
Source: double trust me bro.

Selected Answer: CEF
So I was stumped on this one and the one from before this that is the exact same question just chose 4 instead. I actually found the specific video in the IRM implementation course that says "establish core implementation team" The video is in the first module in the section titled "Identify implementation stakeholders and Team" go to the 1:51 time stamp and youll see that the core team is is a variation or the exact name that I selected as my answer.

Selected Answer: CEF
• Board of directors
• IT Steering Committee
• Chief Information Security Officer (CISO)/ Chief Risk Officer (CRO)
• Audit Committee 
• All levels of management

comments.content: Why wouldnt you include A in your answer then?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
Answer: 
 A. cmn_location
 B. core_company
Explanatin: D and E wouldn've worked, but neither is an existing table in SN, C. department is just a list of departments in the company, which is not a good table to use, which means only A and B are valid choices. 
Source: PDI

Selected Answer: AB
A and B it says choose 2

questions.question_text: Creating Entities in ServiceNow is easier as customers can leverage existing data used in other applications. What are some baseline tables that are commonly used to build an Entity Type? (Choose two.)
